Reviews.Title: “If this was your first stay at a holiday inn express it would probably be your last”
Reviews.Author: Mandymoook
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean all round, but the slow reception service and appalling management of the so called express breakfast buffet (should have been the slow buffet) let the place down. How they'll cope when the Olympics come to town, I'll never know!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Olympic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186394Jo_Jo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the weekend whilst taking part in the Olympic Park Run. Check-in was swift and the staff we very friendly and cheerful. The hotel is brand new with the rooms being very clean and comfortable (bed was a bit soft, my partner and I tended to roll towards each other in the middle a lot!) Breakfast was plentiful it kept me going right through my run and I didn't eat again until 9.30pm!! It's location is perfect for the Olympics and anyone who adores shopping as its's a 4 to 8 min walk from Stratford Station and Westfield shopping centre. I brought ear plugs with me as I can't stand London traffic, and I popped them straight in so can't comment on any traffic noise, however my partner did comment on the noise from next door at 3am! Overall I would recommend this hotel to everyone, esp if your coming to the Games in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with work as we were at a show at Earls Court and its only 15 mins away on the underground and much cheaper. everything about the hotel was great other than the beds, they were soft like a sponge and if you move you are going to fall out. Other memeber of staff in my company had the same problem so none of us slept well. but the hotel is great other wise, you cant hear the road outside or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “And the first Gold Medal goes to...........Holiday Inn Express Stratford.”
Reviews.Author: MJB_Essex
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Saturday (midday) I had booked 2 rooms one for my Wife and myself and one for my daughter and boyfriend . Check in is not till after 14.00 but after enquiring we were told we could have our rooms and continued to dump our stuff off and head off into London (Stratford Station and Westfield Shopping centre 4 minutes walk away). The whole experience was totally professional and friendly ,the rooms are really lovely and spotlessly clean. The shower is fantastic too with a plentiful supply of instant hot water. After a good nights sleep we had a nice breakfast with plenty on offer such as sausages,eggs,beans croissant etc etc. Complementary newspapers were also on offer throughout our stay too. Summing up this is a really nice Hotel and will be a great place to stay for the Olympics and hope they continue to maintain their Gold Medal Status. Thank you for making our Mothers Day weekend an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: UsernameNotFound
Reviews.Content: I'd only stayed at a Holiday Inn once before this time, and then I didn't really pay attention to it as it was before an early flight, but this time round I was absolutely stunned by how amazing it was. Now, I've never stayed at any fancy five star hotels, but I've got to say, they can't possibly top a Holiday Inn. The room was spotless, absolutely beautiful. And what I liked was that they gave you enough pillows for the amount of people sharing the room (unlike a Travelodge who give you thin pillows, and only three...) and there was a choice of soft or firm, which was wonderful. The bathroom was lovely, shiny and beautifully clean. Hot water ran through easily, and the shower was lovely. Every morning that we were there, we were entitled to a complementary breakfast which was also very nice. This Holiday Inn was also in a great location in Stratford, with just a mere five minute walk to Stratford Station, with a small shopping mall opposite the station. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at this Holiday Inn, I would stay there again and again, and would definitely recommened this place to everybody who will listen!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very polite staff!”
Reviews.Author: smithowlsmanchester
Reviews.Content: This bucks the trend that London hotels don't have polite and helpful staff. The staff are attentive, polite and run a clean modern hotel. My second visit here and will keep using it. Breakfast is excellent and lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “a great deal”
Reviews.Author: S J
Reviews.Content: Most central London hotels in this price range are tiny, old, and dumpy. For the trouble of a few extra minutes on the tube, this place is shiny new and nicely outfitted. Nothing fancy, but comfortable and a good breakfast too. Definitely worth the trouble to travel a little farther.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: franzlf
Reviews.Content: Close to Stratford underground station and shopping mall (approx. 10min. by foot). Tube will take you to Oxford street station in 20 minutes. So perfect for visiting London. Check- in was smooth. Professional and friendly staff. Room was clean, well maintained, nicely decorated, comfortable beds.Small bathroom but well equipped. Coffee/tea making facilities available. Rooms at street side can be bit noisy at night when you are a light sleeper. Breakfast was very basic. Eggs were finished at 9.15. No cheese or meat available.Breafast area was in main entrance hall. Cold atmosfhere. For less fussy travellers, its a good priced hotel, on convenient location. You can save good money by staying here instead of choosing a high priced hotel downdown London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: We stayed during our visit to London. The Manager (Harshed) was very helpful in accommodating all our requests and guiding us places to visit. Breakfast was excellent, selection of coffee and Hot chocolate for kids was a excellent choice. We enjoyed our stay ,Next visit we will book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, value for money with a good 10-15 min walk from Stratford Station.”
Reviews.Author: BigMad
Reviews.Content: Good location if you are going to stay during the Olympics. Stratford station is newly renovated with a newly opened Westfield Mall next to it. 40 min from Stratford to Oxford Circut by the tube or 60 min by bus

Reviews.Title: “Quick visit to Stratford, East London”
Reviews.Author: peter b
Reviews.Content: We wanted a couple of nights break in London and got a great room deal through Late Rooms. The hotel is fairly new, I presume built for London 2012 Olympics, and needing finishing touches (eg some plastic covers on bathroom fixtures and only one of two lifts in working order) However the room was clean and comfortable, great bed! Breakfast was self service with a hostel type approach but was adequate. Clearing up a bit slapdash with trays and residue left about, even room service trays in the hallways.Parking onsite is great but limited and not too expensive for London in my experience.All staff we met were polite and helpful. Location is good for the new Westfield shopping centre and will be good for access to the Olympics but not very good directions to stations and amenities when leaving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, would use it again”
Reviews.Author: CarannSheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights when attending an event at the O2 Arena. Directions on website from tube station aren't great. Was told Stratford High Street was closest tube, which it is, but no other directions, so turned the wrong way getting there on my first night and a five mins walk ended up being 25 mins which wasn't fun after a 12 hour day with a suitcase. There's only one small "convenience" store nearly opposite the hotel, other than that, the hotel is in the middle of a road of offices and after being at O2 all day, I didn't want to walk up to the Westfield Centre to eat. However, the hotel itself is good, the room was spacious (and reasonable price) and very clean. Slightly noisy as my room faced the main road, but I'm a country bumpkin, so very noise aware. Nice breakfast (although a little limited), but good coffee, which is always my main priority!

Reviews.Title: “Fire Alarm went off..But ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: springerronald
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and convenient hotel in a good part of Stratford. Check in was very fast as I had booked in advance and staff we pleasant. Room was clean and very spacious. Only gripe was that is for disabled access which I did not need. Bathroom was therefore a bit unusual. Our experience was made slightly more eventful due to the fire alarm going off in the middle of the night. We had to evacuate but luckily it was not too cold outside. Did feel sorry for the couple on their honeymoon though..

Reviews.Title: “Wifi woes”
Reviews.Author: Janeeh040
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was allocated a room that was already occupied and it seemed to go downhill from there. While the hotel is clean and the rooms good organization was not good. I was with a friend who is vegan and every day of our week long stay meant a struggle for breakfast despite prior organization. The biggest gripe though was the wifi policy. As a conference hotel, which was how we were sold it, the expense and lack of flexibility of Internet access was appalling. It is not possible to buy, for example, 24 hours of access and use it across several days. Once logged in you must use it all. This hotel is very close to the Olympic area and will seriously need to lift it's game!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edinburghedge
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia for 9/10 November at £158 for the Wednesday night and £88 for the Thursday night which averaged out to £120 per night. I called to confirm our reservation for a 'smoking room with two twin beds' the night before we arrived and was assured that everything was in order. We checked in at approximately 1:00pm the following day and were told that our 'non-smoking room with one double bed' wouldn't be available until 2:00pm. Obviously the system broke down but the gentleman behind the counter was very helpful and quickly sorted things out for us. We were in room #609 on the top floor which provided a view of the unremarkable east London landscape. The room was small but clean and contained a television, a desk area with a chair, and a kettle with coffee and tea. We found the beds comfortable and each came with two pillows tagged with 'firm' and 'soft' although we couldn't tell the difference. The bathroom was spotless but there are no amenities. The soap and shampoo are one in the same and dispersed from a wall mounted unit in the shower. The towels were a nice size but disappointingly thin. There was no mini-bar or in-room safe, although there are safe deposit boxes in the lobby - there may be a fee attached to use them, we didn't bother. The Expedia website lists 'Wireless Internet Access' as one of the hotel's room amenities but there's a £15 per day charge for that and we passed. The computer in the lobby, if used for less than 10 minutes per day, is free... but longer than that and the £15 charge is applied to your bill. The hotel provides breakfast from 6:30 - 9:30 which is comprised of scrambled eggs, sausage and beans, (it's a British thing), along with the typical assortment of cold items: cereals, breads, fruit. The sausage was extremely poor quality but everything else was quite nice and the hot chocolate from the machine dispenser was surprisingly good. The Stratford International Rail Station offers both the Central and Jubilee tube lines for getting into the city center and the station is roughly a ten minute walk from the hotel. The new Stratford High Street station for the Docklands Light Railway is much closer and very convenient if using City Airport. We knew we were signing up to a budget hotel and we had a pleasant stay here; the staff were terrific and everything was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “:(”
Reviews.Author: csillesz
Reviews.Content: We have arrived after a very long flight to London at 11.00. am. We asked the reception for a possible room, they sent us away with a very rude manner ( a "big" lady). Ok we decided to put our luggages in, as they told they do not have any room which is already usable. No problem. BUT!! In 2 minutes arrived another couple and they could check in!! What kind of hospitality is that? I can tell that is not! The Greek Lady was helpful all the other receptionists behaved like we are unneccessary things in their lives. They sent us to Stratford International as it is the closest station. Stratford High Street is much closer, it is in half way, we realised ourselves! Room was ok, except there is no safe, no fridge, even no toilet brush :) The internet is for charge, the bed is too soft, if you sit down on it, it goes down 50 cms, funny anway. I have asked for an iron 4 times, after that they sent me an iron from the 1980's :) Breakfast is terrible, it is good if you would loose some weight. What they are preparing is without any taste. The apples were fine. If you would like to have a shower take care: if you set for example 38 degrees Celsius , it is sure that it will change suddenly to very hot after that very cold. So you have to be careful if you would have a shower more than 10 seconds. We have booked a double and they've given a twin as "that is the standard room" OMG! So for 500 USD / 2 nights it was almost a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: davek10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night on 24th October. Very good location, right next to the Olympic stadium and 5 minutes walk to the Westfield shopping centre. About 20 minutes by tube or main line train to central london. Very friendly staff and spacious well appointed rooms. not much traffic noise. Good selection for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: sandlLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We had a very clean room, with everything you could need for an overnight stay. It was very comfortable and our room at the back was quiet. The reception staff were helpful about local transport. Breakfast was in a light and airy space which was nice. It was self-service, not great, but OK, served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: princessbadger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the holiday inn express whilst it was being renervated last year. Our room was modern. During our 2 night stay we got locked out of our room due to a fault in the new door. All hotel staff were very accommodating and we were well looked after. Including being given complimentry drinks and a nights stay for free! Breakfast was very busy and basic. Quite a way out but easily accessible by tube. All in all a good hotel and an affordable price in london!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Olympic Park”
Reviews.Author: sportychick1977
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for two nights whilst working in Stratford and it was in an ideal location for Olympic Park. The hotel was generally well looked after. The breakfast was okay, but there were no wholegrain cereals and the waiting staff for breakfast were pretty unhelpful. All in all it does what is says on the tin and is nothing flashy but is better than you would expect for where it is. Expect to pay for wireless internet but the TV has a good selection of channels and you have the tea and coffee making facilities you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel close to Olympic site”
Reviews.Author: Surveyor28
Reviews.Content: I stay here most Wednesdays as I am a surveyor looking after several projects on the Olympic park. The hotel fully meets my needs and is very clean and comfortable. Close to Stratford station and the newly opened Westfield shopping centre. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel and I am confident that all who stay here will have an enjoyable experience. Breakfast / dining area open plan with reception but plenty of space; continental buffet breakfast is excellent. Not ate here as love the Thai cafe across the road.. Car parking is compact and not always guaranteed. All in all a great hotel with excellent staff..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Susan841
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 2 nights. As this hotel is still relatively new, it didn't have that shabby feel that a lot of London hotels have. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful and professional. I ate in the restaurant on the first night, which is really just an extension of the reception area, but OK. The menu is short and basic but the food is cooked well. It was an easy trip into central london in the mornings and a good opportunity to visit the Westfield shopping centre! Overall, I was very happy with my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Quality - Extremely Poor”
Reviews.Author: steviemitch
Reviews.Content: Whilst the room was clean and perfectly adequate, the beds used by HIE are the worst that I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. At £74 per night, I would expect to be able to sleep comfortably. The mattress was too soft, coupled with being on top of a partly-sprung bed base; this made for a night of tossing and turning trying to get some sleep. Overall, I think that this particular hotel is perhaps not managed as well as it could be. One of the lifts was out of order throughout the duration of our stay, the lavatories on the ground floor near the bar were disgusting, and the ashtray outside the front door was overflowing. In the corridor outside our room, there was a leak from the ceiling that dripped into a plastic container. We spoke to the duty manager about the sleep quality and were told that he had not had any complaints, and considering that on the HIE feedback form there is no question relating to sleep quality, I am not surprised! We wrote to HIE to complain on returning home but three days later, no response (not exactly what I would call top-notch customer service). Unless you like to sleep on marshmallows, I would avoid this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “What a mixed bag....”
Reviews.Author: NickyCumbria
Reviews.Content: I have to say if this had been the first Holiday Inn Express I visited it may well have been the last. Yes, it was reasonable (after negotiation), yes clean and the staff very good. So very much under pressure I think, by the manager who sat every day in the bar on the laptop. Every question or complaint was answered with a look over my shoulder to the manager to see if shehad heard and I am sure concerned about the answer given. There was a fire alarm one night of my stay. The evacuation was pitiful, guests were unsure what to do and had to shoulder charge a double fire exit to get it to open. No roll call, and in fact a guest took over the job to ensure everyone was out. Once the all clear was given everyone piled back in, even though the alarm was still going off intermittently. Was it another alarm? Fortunately not, just the fact the staff and the manager didn't know or could not, reset the alarm. I understand this hotel is run by London Inns; I would feel the brand was being damaged by this hotel if I was part of the Holiday Inn Group. I decamped to the Ibis in the end. Maybe not so well appointed but the staff were great and the breakfast offer much more civilised. The Premier Inn at Westfield really will take up so much custom, the Holiday Inn Express will need to up its game. The Olympics might provide a captured market, that is a short term win though. Customer service should work top down...

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential”
Reviews.Author: TrekSaffer
Reviews.Content: Liked: + Location. But cannot fathom why the hotel doesn't advertise that the NEW High Street DLR station is now working...about 100m away, which is a sight closer than Stratford or Pudding Mill Lane Stations. It also has trains straight into London City Airport. And no, Stratford Station is certainly not a 5min walk from the hotel (as stated in one of their web-reservation sites), especially with all the roadworks going on. If you have no bag, you may get the walk done in 15minutes. + 'Complementary' breakfast with the exception of the pseudo-scrambled egg. Great Coffee, freshly ground! + Their limited Dinner menu, with a decent quality/cost. + Friendly Reception staff, who actually spoke English. + Cleanliness: dining room, reception, public areas and bedroom (more on this later) Didn't like: - Bad mattress...no support - Noise from the road. It will go on all the time...I was on the 3rd floor. - Fluctuating water temperature in shower, at ALL times of the day and night - from cold to the limit you set on the thermostat. - Dodgy quality TV reception (satellite), worsening with rain. - Housekeeping service - had to chase them around in the afternoons, sometimes after lunch to get the room done as their priority are the checkouts. - This has nothing to do with the hotel but as interested partners in hosting the world next year, perhaps they can pass the word out: No decent pubs serving proper pub grub around, all the way into the centre of Stratford. They are all so run down...hope their respective owners pull their fingers out of their arses in time for the Olympics...I am not a Londoner (or Brit for that matter), but seriously think that London deserves better calling cards than this. That said, you can purchase a mean curry and rice if you know where, or try asking a cab driver...they'll usually know the best spots for grub are.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Olympics”
Reviews.Author: Mon0ne
Reviews.Content: Invited to an Olympic test run 'London Prepares'. This hotel within walking distance of Stratford Station and the shuttle bus terminus for the Olympic park. Hotel parking £20/24hours but very limited. Rooms very new and comfortable with all all ammenties, internet reasonable priced £1.50/1/2 hour. Breakfast typical of a HHE, basic but wholesome. Did not eat in the evening - but evening meals available. Bar very basic but OK. Service very good staff very friendly and helpful. Room rate was reasonable but check for 2012/Olympic period rack rate >£275!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accommodations in the London Stratford Area”
Reviews.Author: FootlooseWithKids
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Holiday Inn at the tail end of a month long vacation in Europe. Primary reason for selecting this hotel was price. While living up to the Holiday Inn Express promise of a clean and reasonably featured hotel, it was a bit out of the way. With the underground station a 10 minute walk away, this wasn't a huge deal but there wasn't much locally to do. There is a cool looking local pub called the Builders Arms was just up the street, unfortunately for some reason it was closed the weekend we were there so cannot comment, but there is a pub worth visiting called the Edward VII...great food! Anyway the hotel was good, main issue was one of the lifts was broken and stayed that way for our entire 3 days stay. Obvious result was delays in the lobby. We took the stairs when we were impatient, but for those with bags, kids etc it was a pain. Seemed odd that an technician couldn't be arranged...maybe because it was a long weekend? Included breakfast was standard fare. Dinner is available for an extra charge, menu looked Ok but we didn't eat there, instead went to the Edward VII.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: MrsLKC87
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel once before i expected the sae kind of service. I was wrong. My mother in law boked the htel room for us. She booked a double room with a cot for our 11 month old daughter. When we arrived we were told that there had been a mistake and that we were booked in a twin room with no cot. We were told the cot would not fit in the room. So after waiting in the reception area for 30 minutes we were shown a double room which was a smoking room. This was dismissed straight away as it had a horrible smell of stale smoke. So finally after an hour of waiting we were given the twin room that they had origanally booked us in which the cot did fit it. On the thursday afternon we arrived back to the hotel to find that no room service had been. No clean towles,bins not emptied,no tea or coffee ect. So called reception and asked for some new ones. We rang twice in half an hour and in the end my husband had to go down and get it. Then to top it all of the fire alarm sounded at 10pm Thursday night. Unsure of what was happening i called reception 3 times for the phone to go unansweres. i left the room and went to see what was going on.I went from the 5th floor to the ground only for the doors to be locked. I then had to run back up the 5 flights of stairs to tell my husband that we should leave the hotel. Wrapping my daughter in a blanket we left the hotel to find guests and staff all stood outside. We were out there for about 40 minutes. It was freezing and not one memeber of staff came to see if we were ok ( more my daughter than us) No one told us what was going on . Thankfully the police let us sit in there car. When it was safe to go back in there wasnt any staff around to appolagies. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Europe_July_2011
Reviews.Content: If i was paying full price i would have complained, but i didn't want to ruin my holiday. I have stayed a many Holiday Inn's and i am part of their Priority Club Program, i am a GOLD Member. The room was a great size and was very much to the standard of a Holiday Inn Express however the staff and the breakfast cleanliness was not. As a gold member you can normally check in to a hotel anytime after 12noon provided they have a room ready. When i arrived i was not greeted as a PCR member and was told i was to pay 10 pound per hour early check in. This was soon corrected and a room found for me. At Breakfast the drinking glasses were all very dirty. ( they had dry pulp on the inside.... you could feel the pulp when you ran your finger on the inside of the cup). This was not a problem for me until i asked the breakfast staff for a clean glass. Only to be informed that they were all clean and washed in hot water, when i showed the staff member the pulp inside she replied with "there is nothing we can do about the pulp and they have been washed in hot water". (I know how the glass washes work and every glass is supposed to be polished after they come out). The girl on breakfast then told me i could drink from a coffee cup and that she has never gotten sick from drinking out of the glasses. (what happened to customer service? Breakfast was ok the eggs were horrible. There was also a very random vibrating sound every 10 mins coming from somewhere in the room. I couldn't be bothered pointing it out as i knew the staff would reply less than satisfactory. Lucky im a heavy sleeper. After that i shortened my stay and went elsewhere. The hotel itself was comfortable and compliments to the dinner chef when i stayed, i had a very enjoyable lamb shank.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crouching_Hippo
Reviews.Content: I've actually stayed at this hotel on many occasions including a couple of years ago and more recently, back in October last year through to April this year for four nights at a time during the week and I have seen the hotel go from what it was prior to the refurbishment to how it looked in April, which was pretty good considering the amount of refurbishment that has taken place. After reading through some of the reviews, they are mainly positive, which is good, as this hotel deserves to be credited. The hotel is a ten minute walk away from Stratford Station and if you do stay during the winter period, then it can be quite a treacherous walk from the tube station to the hotel. From my first stay, the staff were really friendly and accommodating. In this regard, two members of staff stand out and these are Stella and Joel. I have seen reception crowded and the staff being bombarded with requests for information and also guests wanting to check in and they dealt with everything admirably. I have never eaten at the hotel as due to my work I am either late arriving back at the hotel or I order a take away from the menus that are available from reception, which nobody seemed to mention in their reviews. However I have seen some of the food being delivered to other guests and it doesn’t look that bad at all. 3 courses for just over £15 seems quite reasonable to me. The facilities are what you expect from the HIX brand and I have stayed in many, with most of them being in London. I just haven’t had time to review them all! However, this one stands out as one of the best I have stayed in while working in London. I get the train down from Leeds, so don’t use the car park. If there are indeed only 10 spaces and the charge is £20 per night, then this is quite exorbitant and as some other reviewers have pointed out, you wouldn’t really want to leave your car anywhere else but a secure place overnight. The internet charges are quite steep as well and I have seen these rise over the time I have stayed at the hotel. I now use a dongle as it’s much easier, or failing that, your phone if it’s just browsing that you’re after. There is a convenience store over the road which has the basics of what you might need (they have had enough money from me over the months!), but if you are after something more then there is always the shopping centre opposite the bus station where there is a Sainsbury’s and a Morrisons and a host of other shops. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I am working on the East side of London as it’s ideal. And if you do book in advance and can be fairly certain that your travel arrangements will not change, then you can pick up a room for about £62.00 on an advance rate which I once did. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Boarder57
Reviews.Content: Not a very good location, a good walk from the nearest station (Stratford). Rooms are standard layout for this hotel group, however the walls are very thin, I could hear a telephone call being made in the next room including the replies! Ventialtion is poor, however the staff did provide a fan. At the time the hotel was being used by large parties - so very busy especially at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly suited for us”
Reviews.Author: ShezM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days as a start for a 5 week holiday taking in Europe. The Hotel is within 5-10 minutes walk of the Underground and provided us with a great opportunity to get some 'impromptu' exercise. We did have nice weather though so I wonder whether this would be handy if it was freezing or raining! The rooms were comfortable although they do not provide a mini fridge. This was initially a problem as I require weekly medication that MUST be refrigerated. Reception staff were brilliant - explained the medication issue which was then promptly stored in the bar fridge until we left. Teh downstairs breakfast area/dining was fabulous and having a couple of kids with us made it easy to eat then get them to bed at a reasonable time. All the staff were great - very friendly and nothing was an issue. Managed to get checked in earlier than the usual check in time which was handy given we arrived at Heathrow at 6 am after flying from Australia. There weren't too many convenience stores around to purchase snacks for when relaxing in the room but I gather this will change given it is the perfect location to stay for the upcoming Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: LynnSymone
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel to visit the Take That show, the hotel is located near a station so it was ok. The hotel is over-priced being that you can not get room-service, no lunch and no amenities in the room. We requested a safe but there was none. Internet is chargeable even at the lobby!!!!!!The staff we encountered were good and friendly.The problem we had was the room allocated was leaking in the bathroom and had a (smoky) smell it being in a non-smoking room, i would especially like to thank Stella who resolved our problems quickly and the check-in experience was fantastic. We might return if the rates are lower, but all in all, thanks for a lovely stay. Thanks Stella. Symone & Jan

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, rip off parking fee.”
Reviews.Author: Sean09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if visiting for an event at the O2 , as its about a ten minute walk to the station and then less than ten minutes on the tube to the O2. Easy to drive to just off the A12 but its £20 to park for the night! The hotel price is good and offsets the car park but £20 in this area is outrageous. Room was clean and set up ok for a family of 4. Breakfast was poor but if you are there Saturday night/Sunday morning just have some toast and take a ten minute drive to Brick Lane for a great choice of foods from around the world. Others have said the hotel is badly located but it is actually ideal for getting around, obviosly not to mention what will be happening right there in August next year.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Bigbub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family with two small children and a grandparent, along with extended family in a separate room. The rooms were reasonably sized although by no means large, and were very sparsely furnished. A basic tea / coffee set with hotpot is available, but the amenities don't stretch much beyond that. The area is quite far from the main part of London, and the hotel itself is most obviously set up to take advantage of the upcoming Olympics. Despite the distance from the main area of town, only a small carpark is available if you are driving. Although we had a decent time there, I somehow expected more out of a Holiday Inn hotel. Verdict: reasonable but would recommend other choices first.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: TonyJean121
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The bed was quite okay but there was noise from aircon throughout the nights. It made me hardly to sleep. And the breakfast was so poor. Only scrabbled egg and sausage served in hot plate! I promise that I won't stay in this hotel while I visit London next time!

Reviews.Title: “Par for the course”
Reviews.Author: Dingo1974
Reviews.Content: Anyone who frequently stays in a Holiday Inn Express will know what to expect from the rooms, this one is no different. The hotel is modern and positioned beside a busy main road. An issue with the aircon system meant there was a vibrating noise throughout the night. (as if next door had a mobile phone vibrating on the bedside table). The hotel advertises a car park which is true it does have but what it doesn't say is that there only around 10 spaces. It's a first come first served basis and if you don't get a space you are rather limited to options. Personally I wouldn't like to leave my vehicle parked overnight in the area. As with many Holiday Inn Express hotels Stratford offers a small bar menu on an evening. Overall the food was enjoyable and the service swift. No doubt the hotel will be extremely busy in coming months as it overlooks the Olympic Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MandyMSaltash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night over the Whitsun Bank Holiday Weekend. It is quite a long ride by tube out of central London and a good 10-15mins hike from Stratford station when you have luggage and kids in tow, but the price is very competitive when compared with somewhere closer to central London. The hotel itself is very nice - all new, so very clean and welcoming. Our family room was also clean and adequately equipped, with a choice of firm/soft pillows. Reception staff were helpful and allowed us to leave our luggage there several hours before check-in. The breakfast was something else altogether. The buffet area is cramped when busy. Whilst waiting, supplies of trays, coffee cups and bread all ran out and took a long time to be replenished. There was no bacon at all and they were serving sausages instead which also ran out. I was told there would be more in 5 mins so I waited, then I was told they'd be another 5 mins. Eventually they were brought to our table, but the sausages were so awful, my dogs would've turned their noses up at them.

Reviews.Title: “Full kudos to the staff”
Reviews.Author: RKA2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Easter Weekend on our 2 day visit to Alton Towers. The hotel was very busy owing to the long weekend break. The staff were amazing in accommodating us right thru the 2 days. Breakfast time was a stampede, but the staff coped with it quite well. We were a large group of 5 families with children and all of us felt well looked after and had nothing to complain about. As an inprovement, I would suggest the staff get more support atleast during breakfast time in their busy days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city break”
Reviews.Author: VladOgrean
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel at the end of March this year with family and friends. First of all let me say that the hotel is very cozy and nice, the refurbishing is all done, so no construction noise and posted in previous reviews. Second, in my opinion it's location is great. The Stratford train/tube/bus station is just 8-10 minutes away, 5 minutes if you walk lively. There is a small shopping mall just opposite to the station, and at the end of the year a huge mall will open right besides the station, so that will be great. so like i said, easy and quick access to any part of london, mind you, there is also a bus station right in front of the hotel, but i would not recommend you take the bus from the central area to the hotel, because it will be a 1 hour journey at least, so take the tube instead, much faster. All in all, the hotel is perfect for a weekend get-away, or even a longer visit to london. one more thing, if you do decide to visit london and stay at this hotel, if you arrive in london via luton and you travel in a group of 4-5-6 people, i recommend you hire one of those private taxi's, instead of taking a bus to central london and then the tube to stratford. Besides the fact that you don't have to walk around dragging you luggage along, if you are a group of 5 people, it will cost you almost the same and bus+tube, so better choice all around (not applicable if only 2-3 persons).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel and location, badly let down by breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JDH2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a short weekend visit to London. On the positive side, it is a short walk from the centre of Stratford and the transport interchange which allows bus, rail, underground or DLR travel. It is around 20-25 mins to Westminster on the Jubilee Line. The hotel itself is fairly new already but has just been refurbished. The check-in was smooth but nothing special. The room was fine, the sofa bed had been set up for our little one and the shower room has a neat feature whereby the door can shut on the toilet allowing the shower/basin to be used by someone else. The main bed was quite soft, the sofa bed seemed more comfortable to me. Our room was a little noisy as it overlooked the main road and several emergency vehicles seemed to pass during the night! However, all the positives were undone by the breakfast. Holiday Inn Express are making a big deal about their breakfasts now having hot food. Well, ours didn't, in fact I think we'd have grounds to report them to the ASA. As we arrived just before 9am, the last of the sausages and bacon had been finished by other guests. In the 15-20 minutes we were there, these were not replenished at all. For a time there were no mugs for tea/coffee, there were no small spoons for drinks or yoghurts and the fruit juice was without doubt a mix of at least 80% juice 20% water - and that is being charitable. In addition, tables were left strewn with dirty plates and cups - not clear if it was self-clearing or not! We are staying in another HI Express next month, I hope this experience is not repeated!

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay.”
Reviews.Author: dsheane
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 nights b&b in this hotel. Suited us fine as a base to visit friends nearby and to have a day in city centre. Stay closer to city centre if you are on a purely sight seeing holiday as the surrounding area is under regeneration and not very interesting. Very clean hotel, provided all the essentials. Pleasant stay nothing fancy!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Hales206
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very average although good enough for somewhere to stay at a reasonable price. The rooms are clean and have a lovely shower area. We stayed at the hotel as it is only 3 stops on the tube to the O2 (as we were seeing Peter Kay) which only takes about 15 mins so it is good from that perpsective. However, my sleep was very deprived which ruined the next day as I was so tired. The beds were a little uncomfortable and the noise from the road was very loud form cars, buses etc. to people walking past. You can literally hear peoples conversations word for word on the street below. Better sound proofing could go a long way. The breakfast is also not great.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, but dissappointing breakfast and entrance”
Reviews.Author: skycruiserNL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel pre Christmas in December 2010. A trip including 2 nights in this hotel, which was reasonable priced for London standards. The hotel location is fair since the walking distance to Stratford station (Underground Julilee and Central line, DLR) and the Stratford shopping centre. During our stay a lot of construction works going on for the 2012 Olympics, but not nearby the hotel, it's closer to the station. The check-in was very good, since we got a room immediately (even before noon!). Maybe it helped since I am priority club member. The room was on the 4th floor and very spacious. The bed was just renewed (matress) I personally didn't find it comfortable for sleeping. Also the room to outside did not properly close, so the room had "fresh" air all the time. The bathroom was spacious also, showergel and shampoo is provided for, as well towels replaced every day. The only item to complain in the bathroom is the not so constant temperature of the warm water. During my showers, it was flucuating to "very hot" and "ice cold" and back to my desired temperature. It was frustrating, sometimes. Anyway we were in London for the town, not the hotel, so the rooms in this hotel are very well ok. I must ask your and the hotel's attention for the breakfast, through! It was located in a large room (size of 3 hotel rooms, walls removed) and very warm inside. Food was available in the hall, where some tables were positioned (see photo). Variaty of food was limited or out of stock, refills took too long. Another item which I didn't like was the WiFi internet which is charged for. Nowadays this should be very common. In several countries it's normal to find WiFi for free in bars and even 2* hotels. Why can't Holiday Inn (Express) not make such arrangements? Even if that needs to be charged for, raise your hotel room fare with GBP 0.50 per night to get out of the investment, instead of charging these high fares for just 30 minutes. I conclude that this hotel is convenient for shopping, quietly located in outer-London but easy to reach. Room spacious, breakfast not good. Pricing is average but for the service we got maybe a bit expensive. I think it's a hit or miss during your future stay and I would recommend you to consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly awful staff with no customer service skills at all, even after my colleague's room was robbed.”
Reviews.Author: katmandoobie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for work and it was absolutely awful. By far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in in this country. Firstly the hotel was a building site, apparently being revamped for the olympics - but God help anybody who stays there, the customer service is shocking. Whilst we were at work, my colleague's room was emptied of her stuff, even though she was still checked in for another night. When she asked reception what had happened to it they said the maid must've removed t by mistake and it would be in lost property. After checking, it became apparent that all that was there was a pair of jeans - absolutely everything she brought with her had been stolen, either from the room by the maid, or from lost property. They even took her toothbrush and underwear. Reception were not apologetic or helpful at all - they said they didn't know who had cleaned the room and we would have to wait until the next day at 9am when the maids came in for work. I said this was not acceptable and the reception manager got very agitated. I asked him to provide a toothbrush, toothpaste and other necessities for my colleague from a machine in the reception with petty cash as it was the least he could do and he was rude and said no initially, until we asked him several times when he at last gave in. We had a lot of children staying in the hotel with us that night, almost 200 and the hotel were unable to cater for them. Becuase of the building work (they didn't tell us about) there was dining available in a conference room on the third floor. The food was served from the kitchen on the ground, pushed through the building site on a trolley wth clingfilm on top and brought up in a lift. It was cold and there was not enough to go round - the chef was constantly running up and downstairs to make more and we had a queue of hungry kids all the way down the corridoor for over an hour. The food provided was unacceptable, we had paid £10 a head for a healthy meal and drink for the children but were told firstly that a drink was not included (even though we had paid for it) and it took four of us to demand that the children were at least served some fruit squash with their meal. THe 'healthy meal' was some inedible mince, chips and vegetables which were stll frozen in the centre - we know because we checked. Or, for the vegetarians, dry pasta with a scoop your own sauce that looked and tasted like cheap tomato soup, served in a bowl on the table so it went cold quickly and was not replaced throughout the servce. It was absolutely disgusting. Many of the kids went to bed hungry and some went out to buy pot noodles out of their own pocket. The previous night I was told that there was no vegetarian option and when I said to the reception manager "what happens if one of the children is vegetarian?" he replied simply "then they shall not eat this evening, we have nothing for them". I could go on forever about how bad this hotel was but the main thing is that I would never in a million years stay there again and my company has now struck it off our list of approved accommodation, so hopefully they will lose a lot of business as we are one of the biggest corporations in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: pettaspagna
Reviews.Content: Hi this hotel is an extraordinary good one, if consider how much you pay and how much you get. I had already stayed in this hotel chain in scotland, thus I knew it. It is quite near the "underground Stratford" station, with the Oyster card it is just 2.4 pounds, and considering you will pay this twice a day, you save much more money staying slightly more far away from the city centre. Rooms are BIG, breakfast is good, even with some hot food. I definitely reccomend it ! Riccardo

Reviews.Title: “total let down”
Reviews.Author: davefiat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as my wife was working nearby I had nothing on so went with her. I was unable to work though as unlike other Hi expresses there was no free wi-fi in reception area for priority club members. The heating was broken I reported it in the morning and was not offered a room change or a heater, the reception girl just said well no one else has complained! so had to stay in a freezing room all day. When my wife arrived back from work in the evening how ever she made a complaint to another member of staff and was offered a room change or a heater, we took the heater as having spoke to other guests we realised the heating was broken in all rooms. Breakfast was a joke, no vegetarian yoghurts. I wanted to warm a croissant on top of the toaster but the breakfast guard screamed at me saying it would cause a fire, I argued with her that it wouldn't as I do it all the time at home, but she said the cabinet they was in will warm them and I should come back later as it takes some time, I went back an hour later and they were still cold but now also had rock hard bottoms! So I opted for toast instead, this soon went ice cold too though as they had the air-con in dinning area set to low. Twice staff entered our room with out even knocking on the first day, on the 2nd day staff kept knocking very loudly even though i had the sleeping sign on the door, i was trying to catch up on the sleep I had missed on the first night from being too cold and had booked a late check out, but they still knocked several times so I still had no sleep. I was not asked how my stay was on check out so did not complain any more but I did fill out a questionnaire that was put under our room door, it had no where on it to put contact details, but i did add my email address so the manager could write to me with at least and apology but they haven't. i was gutted as this hotel was built for the 2012 Olympics I thought the standard would be high but it was far from it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit like the curate's egg!”
Reviews.Author: suffolkdale
Reviews.Content: Close to tube station/central London via Central Line - good, new rooms - good, service -good. But very aware of the building work which means reception is a bit like the clerk of works office (but with wine bottles!), and breakfast in the meeting room is rather third world. Cleanliness throughout the hotel public rooms suffers from the building work, understandably in some respects, but this is not reflected in a discounted price. The surrounding area is a mixture of Newham grot and Olympic gloss!

Reviews.Title: “Out of Order Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sealifefamily
Reviews.Content: I am also a hotelier and stayed in this hotel because it is very close to excell london. But unfortunately it was not good experience as last season in another holiday inn canning town!.. Very huge refurbishment took place and restaurant was closed, so we took our breakfast in meeting rooms and you may guess that it was not functioning as a proper restaurant such as ambiance etc. One of the lift was out of order and we have waited long and long times for car to arrive our floor, poor staff was waiting and suffering also a lot... Vending outomats , ice mashine were also out of order, after long complaining sessions on last day elevator and vending machine id fixed... And finnaly it was very bad holiday inn experience and since an old holiday inn staff it was totally un exceptable...Sorry guys in very busy exhibition period you should not have right to run hotel with construction atmosphere and with many o.o.o facilities!...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kendo54
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four nights and had a great time. The place was spotless, rooms comfortableand, great breakfasts and extremely friendly staff. Hello Harry! Sure there is some building work going on but neither of us found it in the least disruptive. Thanks to evetyone for making us feel so welcome!! Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Awfull !”
Reviews.Author: Wulfie
Reviews.Content: Bloody Awful, This best describes our experience of this hotel, we used it for a one night stay whilst my wife went to see Bon Jovi at the O2. You really need to avoid this hotel, The staff are completely unhelpful, when we asked for advice on parking we were given NO HELP, worse still when we did find a meter to park on, and asked for change at reception we were directed to the shop across the road! Parking is a nightmare Room was grubby Toilet would not flush Very noisy location I am a platinum member of the IHG Priority club, and regularly use HI or HI Express hotels, this place is a disgrace !

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service - tried to charge me £30 more than the amount I booked the room for!”
Reviews.Author: sat33_10
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 person room at this hotel for £60 in total. When I tried to check in, the guy at reception told me that it is £30 more for the third person even though it does not specify this anywhere on the reservation confirmation and actually states 3 persons on the confirmation - £60 in total. I had a print out of the reservation confirmation but the man told me that it doesn't matter - £90 in total. I asked to speak to the manager but the manager wouldn't come over to talk to me. We were so angry that we didn't stay and decided to get a taxi home which is why I have not rated other aspects of the hotel eg cleanliness, as I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what it looks like in the HI website”
Reviews.Author: andym1954
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its convenience to the O2 Arena and stayed for 2 nights. The walk from Stratford station takes around 15 minutes and is fairly straightforward. In that area of London there is a lot of building work going on for the Olympics and this hotel is also being extended. Although this is mentioned on the website the picture of the hotel doesnt show this. As we stayed at the weekend it wasnt too much of a problem as no work was going on but I would imagine that it may be different during the week. Breakfeast is mainly continental but with the introduction of a couple of hot items it is a little better than it used to be with this chain. We had a meal in the hotel on one night which was standard pub fayre but a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “stay away till it is renovated - no ac - no lift - little hot water - food stinks”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1008
Reviews.Content: At first this place seemed like a nice place to stay for a business trip although it was a bit far from the office. but after the first morning breakfast every thing started going down-hill. the aircon stopped working and the staff was in no rush to get it fixed. hot water in the sink worked only 50% of the times. They gave me a fan after 2 nights and after discussing the situation with 2 managers. Oh a few general things to know about this hotel -- the food at the hotel is mediocre at best -- there are very few eateries near this hotel -- there is no clock is the room so come prepared if you need to be some place on time -- the walk from the underground station is at least 18 min.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay with a proper budget”
Reviews.Author: saagarshinde
Reviews.Content: Its a very good place to stay specially when you are thinking of your budget in mind. The service is really good & the staff is really helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Express by Holiday Inn and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamLola
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three non-consecutive nights for business and what started off as terrible first impressions only got worse. I arrived on a Sunday evening after a horrendous journey to find that the car park indicated by the large sign on the side of the building was not there. I enquired at reception where I might park and was told to "leave it on the yellow lines, it'll be ok"! Needless to say I didn't, but parked down the road then spent most of the night worrying about my car as the hotel is in what could generously be described as a dubious area. The check in was poor the first time, but was better than the second time when I was left waiting at the reception desk for almost 15 minutes at which point I was checked in by a woman talking on the phone and I don't believe she actually said more that two words to me. I was absolutely amazed to find that while there were multiple pay tv channels there was not even basic digital tv. The food was overpriced and of poor quality. My chicken ceasar salad (according to the menu with anchovy fillets and parmesan shavings - though I could find none!) was essentially bland overcooked chicken on a bowl of soggy iceberg lettuce swimming in ceasar dressing. The cheeseburger I ordered the following night arrived minus cheese accompanied by cold overcooked chips, I didn't bother complaining after witnessing the man at the next table trying to complain that his hot chocolate fudge cake wasn't hot and being brought a mug of hot chocolate and told it was ok he could eat the cake anyway! The bed was not comfortable, the window seal came away from the frame, you had to practically break your finger in order to close the window and the builders with diggers in the hotel car park started work at 6:50 am - all in all not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jameswameek
Reviews.Content: I was visiting our offices in the vacinity of London Liverpool Street Station, and needed somewhere out of the city (so cheap),but still close enough. 15 mins walk from tube/national rail station, good service when I got there and even a view of the olympic park (from the second floor, through the adjacent tower blocks. Would definately recomend this hi.express.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine but front desk service disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Carousel30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine - what you would expect from Express by Holiday Inn. Not in a particularly nice part of town to come back to late at night but I know the area and that didn't bother me particularly. The rate was great at £58 (including continental breakfast) for a fairly last-minute booking. I booked the hotel and my husband had to check us in as I was going to arrive late - I rang reservations to check this would be OK and they said it would be as long as he was named as an additional guest (which I did online) and he had my credit card - we arranged this and he checked in fine, paid the £58 and got a receipt. On checkout, the receptionist asked for an additional £35 on top of the £58 already paid as she insisted that there had been a third person staying in our room! We said that this was not the case, but she was having none of it. She went off for several minutes to talk to someone in a back room, then came out and demanded information from me to prove that the rate I had paid was the one I had booked - I had a confirmation printed from my e-mails but because I had printed in the wrong view it did not have this. I insisted that there had only been two overnight guests, and she finally, after several more minutes of pouting and general rudeness, said that she would not be charging me an additional £35 as if she was doing me some kind of favour. I was not at all impressed and this would put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “centre of east london”
Reviews.Author: vinchy
Reviews.Content: we have stayed twice in the holiday inn express.The best bits about is the location, the polite staff-i(ndika - night manager and sudhaker ) , the breakfast and assistance . Overall it was a good experinece - the 2nd visit was slightly marred by loss of airconditioning - but we were given a fan -that did help and a apology was given -accepted! Rooms are average for HIexpress and it would help if both the lifts work! rather than one . as its Priced reasonably for the facilities . i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would return without hesitation - if the location was better.”
Reviews.Author: YorksLadyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned, the surrounding areas are slightly run down, and if you're thinking of staying here it would be an idea to acquaint yourself with the area beforehand, and to buy an Oyster card. We arrived before midnight but felt apprehensive when the cab driver advised us to be extra careful - especially late at night. It wasn't the best of introductions to the area, but like most stations in busy cities, it did have a few dubious characters wandering around. But please remember this was only at the station itself, which is within easy reach of the hotel. The cab fare was approximately £7.00 from the station to the hotel, so good value, especially when travelling with heavy cases late at night. But if you're not averse to the few dubious characters, it's easily walkable to the hotel and is also on a bus route - one stop from Stratford station. The check in was fine and we were allocated a top floor room overlooking the main and very busy road. This wasn't a problem to us as both lifts were working fine and even if you're a very light sleeper, the double glazing drowns out most of the noise. But if you like to sleep with the window open, it would be advisable to ask for a room on the other side. The room was large and clean, as was the bedding and the bathroom. No faults at all with the housekeeping - it was exemplary. The only minor negative point was a stain on the cover of the sofa but as we only used it to put bags on, it wasn't a problem. The bed tended to lean towards the middle, but was comfortable after a hectic day spent in London. The bathroom, which is in fact a shower room, was spotless, as were the towels. We always take our own toiletries but there are dispensers for hand and body wash near the sink and in the shower, and a vending machine near the foyer if you forget anything like toothpaste. The nearby shopping centre in Stratford should cover just about anything else you may need. As has been mentioned in previous reviews, there was no hot food available that weekend, but the receptionists are more than happy to order a take-away for you to eat in your room, providing it's not overly late. The take-away menus, although of limited choice, can be found near the vending machine, and one meal was ample to feed two of us, and at approximately £10 including delivery, good value for London. The continental breakfasts are standard but adequate enough to start the day off. If, as we did, you find yourself slightly disorientated with the area, just ask. The girls on reception were a credit to the hotel, and if they couldn't immediately help with directions to various places, they Googled the areas and handed us printouts, which was a very kind and helpful gesture. I can't recommend highly enough the benefits of buying an Oyster card on your arrival in London, especially if you're staying for sight-seeing in London. These, topped up with £30 each, was more than enough for us to traverse across the city and further, and to have credit available at the end of the stay. Much cheaper than taxis. There's a bus stop a couple of minutes away from the hotel, and it's only one stop to Stratford station. As it was a weekend, there were various disruptions due to works being carried out, but at no time did we find this a problem. There's alternative routes to be taken and the station staff were very helpful. If returning from London to Stratford, and need a bus to the hotel, go to platform C at the bus station and get on any red bus - it's as easy as that, and where your Oyster card comes in handy. It's also handy for the DLR and buses. Should you wish to travel out to Beckton to the smaller shopping outlets, it's one stop from the hotel to the station, and a bus (I think it was the 252 or 262 but please ask - the local people were also more than helpful) takes you directly to Beckton Triangle (with it's Next and Boots clearance stores) or Gallion's Reach shopping centre, and which takes under an hour. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and the hotel staff. The only downside was the distance from the city to the hotel, especially if you need to return more than once in a day, (but who'd want to?) and the lack of cooked food at the weekend. If you prefer to travel by taxi to and from the hotel it might work out cheaper to book a Holiday Inn that's more central. If not, then I'd recommend this hotel if you're travelling by car, or for a long weekend providing you don't mind the DLR and frequent tube changes.. If we could have picked this hotel up, and dropped it to a place nearer the attractions, it would have been near perfect for our needs. Our stay cost us £159 for 3 nights B&B, but look around for any offers at the Holiday Inn site. Thank you to all at the hotel and I hope this has been of some help to any readers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: secretadmirer76
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever experience in any Lodge/Inn, we went out for a trip to see London attractions with our family, booked 3 rooms, (5 children in total, various ages) Hotel was extremely clean,room was lovely, shower room was really nice, breakfast was nice, got good value for money, parking was available just outside the hotel at £7 per night which was reasonable, had no problems at all and enjoyed our stay Stratford station is just minutes away, theres a nice takeway/cafe at the station, easy access to tubes/town centre, nice quiet Residential Area

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ritapaola
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually very nice although hard to find at night if you had to walk. The area was run down but once you got out to the underground it was ok. Breakfast was good and had a lot of options. The room was nice, clean and quiet. Overall a good hotel to stay in and value for money for London.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: princegrounds
Reviews.Content: Myself my wife and 4 children have just returned from London. we stayed at the express by holiday inn at Stratford. For the price of the accomadation which included a continental breakfast the hotel was very clean, we booked 2 rooms which included a double and sofa beds which were very comfortable. The rooms were tidied every day and towels changed. the best thing about the hotel was the location, close to a tube and bus station. Overall we felt very safe in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: sc3traveller
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with our recent visit to the Stratford Holiday Inn. We arrived on New Year's Eve at around 12:00 and were allowed to check in, even though normal check in time starts at 2:00. We had requested a room at the back of the building (not facing the busy highway), but were told this information was not on their booking system. I found this rather peculiar since I had booked directly with the hotel website. In the end, the reception staff accommodated our request without too much persuasion. The room was clean and compact; no complaints. I did notice that instead of providing a complimentary shampoo/shaving cream/ sewing kit, etc. in the bedroom, you must now request it from staff. Cost cutting I suppose. Overnight, the room was quiet and we had a restful sleep (no outdoor noise or sounds from neighbouring rooms) - a real feat considering it was New Year's Eve! The one drawback to this hotel is its location in East London. It takes about 25 minutes to travel by underground to Westminster station (central London), plus approx 10-15 minutes to walk to the Stratford station. That said, I feel it is not unreasonable as long as you only take the trip once a day. However, if you like to do a bit of sightseeing and then come back to your room and relax before heading out again, you'll find this hotel's location inconvenient. Access to London via the Stratford station is flexible, with the Jubilee, Circle and DLR lines, as well as Overland trains operating from this station. There is a bus depot outside the Stratford station. Depending on what underground ticket you purchase, it may include buses, which would cut down on your walking time to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I've been to better”
Reviews.Author: Taff84
Reviews.Content: It took forever to book in as they had lost our reservation, despite giving confirmation details to them. There is parking available but at a cost of £12. The bedroom was ok. Comfortable bed and basic facilities available. The bathroom was a let down. There was no bath and it was rigged up for disabled customers, which posed a problem. There was a very sensitive emergency cord hanging in the middle of the shower which, when knocked, alarms reception. If you accidently knock this, expect many calls from the reception desk! Overall, I was disappointed with what we got for the money...

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Limited Parking”
Reviews.Author: Ellie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night on business. Booked via last minute.com - free parking included. On arrival it became clear that parking wasnt included. I was advised that I could park in their carpark at a cost of £12- but unfortunatly there weren't any spaces available. The rooms were clean and spacious, with a standard buffet style breakfast. Ive also stayed at the Express near the MIllenium Dome, which I would recomed over this one. Free parking for a start! I probably wont book with Express again though - they've put their prices up recenty. Some of them by an additional £50 per night. Used to be a good hotel chain offering good value for money, a touch up the range from Premier Travel Inn. However..You can now stay at a Hilton Hotel for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price, Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: quiet-listener
Reviews.Content: It's the staff at this hotel that make it outstanding. Very helpful and extremely friendly. If they didn't have the answer to a question, they got it for you. The rooms are quite small compared to American hotel rooms, but then again, that's usual in England. Breakfast was good and enough to get you through well into the day. Locations is a little out of the way, and not in the greatest of neighborhoods, but we felt safe walking there at night. The subway was just a couple of blocks away and there is a good shopping center just outside it. The bus will take you right in front of the hotel I recommend this hotel for a fairly inexpensive and very welcoming stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: LesAlanos
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've stayed at this outer London hotel on many occasions and have not been dissapointed. I can undersatnd many of the more negative comments reference the location, and the surrounding area, but that said you do get what you pay for in London. If you're an overseas visitor I suggest taxi from the train station particularly at night. Personally i found the staff to be excellent the rooms are always clean and the continental breakfast is first class. It is though on a main road, and it's busy all night. Light sleepers I suggest a room at the back. If you're travelling by car, make sure to book a space. At night try the Pie Crust cafe across the road. Don't be put off by the decor. Whilst it looks like a run down cafe put your pre conceptions behind you. It serves some excellent thai food. You usually find an ecletic mix of clients.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: chinaski7628
Reviews.Content: Just okay. Nice shower, especially for Americans not used to European showers, this one was just like home. Breakfast was decent and the staff was friendly. I've had worse and I've had better...

Reviews.Title: “Will never go there again”
Reviews.Author: hgillesp
Reviews.Content: We turned up just before 2 and asked to bok in the trainee receptionist very rudely told us to sit down. When we were finaly allowed to check in she was rude again to the other staff in front of us. The room itself was ok the bed was comfortable. If you stay here fri sat or sun they do not do food instead you are shown to an area where take away menus are and you have to order in?????????????????????????????????? When asking for drinks we asked for a single shot but got a double and charged for a double they don't listen to what you say. We advised the hotel when we got there we had prepaid through last minute.com and showed them the paperwork but on checking out they tried to charge me again and when i asked for an invoice to show no money had been taken off my card all i got was i can't do that so i insisted they did and got a plain bit of paper with a quick note scribbled on it. This may all sound petty but the rudeness of the staff was awful and did not seem to understand english.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express London Stratford
HotelInfo.Address: 196 High Street, London E15 2NE, England
